passages.text: Switzerland | Building, Construction & Housebuilders Geberit

Despite 2Q25 reporting a small miss, we believe risk of a tricky period was well- known and Geberit still delivered growth at the upper end of construction peers. From here, we continue to see Geberit as a quality play on European recovery, with further upside potential from customer inventory build- up in advance of this and accelerating pricing. Despite trading at 21.2x 2026E EV/EBITDA, we see Geberit as a quality name with attractive near- term exposure.

JEFe adjusted EBITDA nudged down by c.1- 2% pa, but lower one- offs suggest limited change to 2025 reported EBITDA. As is usual for Geberit at 1H, the most recent release contained the first quantitative guidance for the year. 2025 organic growth is guided to \(+4\%\) (exactly in line with consensus at time of reporting; JEFe \(+3.7\%\) ) and EBITDA margin guided to around \(29\%\) (consensus \(29.3\%\) , JEFe \(28.6\%\) ). Our EBITDA forecasts have been cut by c.1- 2% pa. This is partly due to a slight reduction in organic sales growth (c.20bps this year) - while we have mildly upgraded key markets like Germany and Austria due to better- than- expected trends in 1H25, this has been offset by cuts to Switzerland (selective pricing adjustments to offset CHF strength) and Western Europe (ongoing market decline in France). The drop- through impact from slightly lower top line growth has also driven a slightly lower adjusted EBITDA margin pa. However, given 2025- 26 one- off costs have been guided to lower (c.CHF25m in total from c.CHF40m previously), JEFe's reported EBITDA has seen limited change for 2025.

July trading looks reassuring with benefit of inventory build- up still to play out. We forecast c. \(+5\%\) organic sales growth pa at the group level in future years, but also in its largest market, Germany (c. \(30\%\) of group sales). With improving data and sentiment in Germany, we carry a mild boost (c. \(1\%\) ) from inventory build- up in 2026 which we would expect to materialise ahead of any underlying recovery. As of end- 2Q25, management said customer inventories were at normal levels, not excessive despite pre- buying in 1Q25 ahead of the April price increase, suggesting any benefit from inventory build- up in anticipation of a recovery is yet to be seen in Geberit's earnings. Despite 2Q25 organic growth below market expectations (+2.5% YoY with headwinds from fewer working days and normalisation of the pre- buying in 1Q25), July trading seems to have shown- sequential improvement with growth said to be in line with the full- year guidance (i.e. \(\pm 4\%\) ). While 1H25 pricing was only c. \(0\%\) , this should improve as the year progresses (the impact of April/ May deliveries done at old prices prior to the April price increase should be into 2H25), albeit the price adjustments in Switzerland to offset FX movements may persist for longer.
Please see analyst certifications, important disclosure information, and information regarding the status of non-US analysts on pages 5-10 of this report. \\* Jefferies International Limited
TARGET I ESTIMATE CHANGE

Exhibit 1 - Geberit - Changes to JEFe

Source: Jefferies estimates. \\*Post-IFRS 16.
Source: Jefferies estimates. \\*Post-IFRS 16.

Investment Thesis / Where We DifferWith increasing evidence of better construction prospects in Europe, we see Geberit as a key beneficiary of improving investor sentiment here, not just due to its sales exposure (c. \(90\%\) Europe, c. \(30\%\) Germany) but also its reputation for quality (sector- leading margin, returns and FCF). While we see consensus as reasonable for now (JEFe low single- digits ahead ex- FX), a sharper recovery could offer further volume upside.
Risk/Reward - 12 Month View

Base Case, CHF696, \(+18\%\) Sales growth: \(+3.9\%\) average per a year 2025- 28E (this includes FX headwinds), and \(+6\%\) pa over the medium term (2029- 32E), i.e. upper end of \(4 - 6\%\) organic growth target. // Adjusted EBITDA margin \(29.5\%\) in 2028E, and \(30\%\) beyond (upper end of \(28 - 30\%\) mid- term target). // DCF - WACC is \(6\%\) (4% risk- free rate; \(6\%\) equity market premium; Geberit's equity beta 0.5x); \(2.8\%\) perpetual growth rate. // Price target = CHF 696

Upside Scenario, CHF884, \(+49\%\) Sales and EBITDA reflecting our "bull" scenario of German housing transactions back to pre- COVID norms by 2028, suggesting a stronger mid- term recovery in Geberit's largest market // DCF carries a slightly lower risk- free rate than rest of sector to reflect Swiss listing (i.e. \(3.5\%\) rather than \(4\%\) ), implying WACC \(5.6\%\) // Upside price target = CHF 884

Downside Scenario, CHF374, \(- 37\%\) Sales growth: \(3\%\) lower sales growth in 2025E versus current JEFe, \(5\%\) lower sales growth in 2026E versus current JEFe, and \(+4\%\) growth pa beyond (lower end of \(4 - 6\%\) organic growth target). // Adjusted EBITDA margin \(28\%\) in 2025E and beyond (lower end of \(28 - 30\%\) target). // DCF - WACC is \(6\%\) (4% risk- free rate; \(6\%\) equity market premium; Geberit's equity beta 0.5x); \(2.3\%\) perpetual growth rate. // Downside price target = CHF 374
Top Material Issue(s): Waste, water, biodiversity, air quality - With water seen as a scarce resource, many of Geberit's products aim to drive water savings.
Company Target(s): Reduce \(CO_2\) intensity by an average of \(5\%\) pa (scope 1 and 2). \(CO_2\) emissions to be reduced by \(70\%\) by 2030 and by \(80\%\) by 2035 (2015 baseline).

Qs to Mgmt: Given a lot of your products help with water savings, are you seeing much regulation driving demand for these products? How much capex and what sort of timeframe is needed in your more energy- intensive ceramics plants to convert these to being more energy- saving or to use renewable energy sources?
Link to ESG Integration Sector Report - here

CatalystsIncreasing confidence in German and/ or European construction growth; German stimulus confirmed to benefit markets that could directly benefit Geberit; Wholesaler restocking ahead of underlying market pick- up; Lower inflation or deflation of key costs (e.g. metals, plastics, wages); Lower interest rates boosting underlying demand, but also investor demand for high- value stocks; Weaker CHF, especially against €; Step- up in share buyback programme.
Exhibit 2 - Geberit - Financials
Source: Jefferies estimates, Company data
Exhibit 3-Gebert-Key metrics
Source: Jefferies estimates, Factset, Company data. \\*Price at close on 28 August.

Geberit is a market- leading sanitary product manufacturer, with heavy exposure to Europe (c. \(90\%\) of sales) and demand largely driven by bathroom renovation activity. Its traditional focus has been behind- the- wall products (e.g., hidden all- in- one systems to enable functioning of toilets, basins), but since the major acquisition of Sanitec in 2015, it also produces front- of- wall products (e.g., bathroom ceramics).

Valuation: Our price target is derived using DCF. The WACC is \(6.0\%\) , reflecting a \(4\%\) risk- free rate and \(6\%\) equity market premium, which is also used for sector peers. The equity beta for Geberit is 0.5x, reflecting its relatively defensive characteristics. The perpetual growth rate is \(2.8\%\) , slightly ahead of long- run inflation and the rate applied to sector peers valued using DCF. Upside/downside risks include faster/ slower European macro growth, faster/ slower penetration growth of products, lower/higher cost inflation, faster/ slower innovation, and weaker/ stronger CHF.
(Article 3(1)e and Article 7 of MAR) Recommendation Published

Buy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period. Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period. Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period. The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) is \(20\%\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus \(20\%\) within a 12- month period. For Underperform rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus \(20\%\) or less within a 12- month period.
NR - The investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies.
CS - Coverage Suspended. Jefferies has suspended coverage of this company.
NC - Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company.

Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations.
Monitor - Describes securities whose company fundamentals and financials are being monitored, and for which no financial projections or opinions on the investment merits of the company are provided.

Jefferies methodology for assigning ratings may include the following: market capitalization, maturity, growth/value, volatility and expected total return over the next 12 months. The price targets are based on several methodologies, which may include, but are not restricted to, analyses of market risk, growth rate, revenue stream, discounted cash flow (DCF), EBITDA, EPS, cash flow (CF), free cash flow (FCF), EV/EBITDA, P/E, PE/growth, P/CF, P/FCF, premium (discount)/average group EV/EBITDA, premium (discount)/average group P/E, sum of the parts, net asset value, dividend returns, and return on equity (ROE) over the next 12 months.

Jefferies Franchise Picks include stock selections from among the best stock ideas from our equity analysts over a 12 month period. Stock selection is based on fundamental analysis and may take into account other factors such as analyst conviction, differentiated analysis, a favorable risk/reward ratio and investment themes that Jefferies analysts are recommending. Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Stocks will be added as new opportunities arise and removed when the reason for inclusion changes, the stock has met its desired return, if it is no longer rated Buy and/or if it triggers a stop loss. Stocks having 120 day volatility in the bottom quartile of S&P stocks will continue to have a \(15\%\) stop loss, and the remainder will have a \(20\%\) stop. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.
Geberit (GEBN SW: CHF591.60, BUY)
